title: Reforested Areas Rival Mature Forests in Securing Water
description: Young reforested areas in Madagascar retain rainwater as effectively as mature forests, reducing runoff and erosion while boosting groundwater reserves.

title: Amazon Deforestation Leads to Drier Dry Seasons
description: Study in Rondônia and Mato Grosso found 3.2% forest loss caused 5.4% reduction in dry season rainfall, showing Amazon precipitation is highly sensitive to forest cover.

title: Panama Indigenous-Led Reforestation Restores Hydrological Cycles
description: Researchers in Panama work with Indigenous communities to reboot ecosystems and restore hydrological cycles through native species reforestation.

title: Tropical Deforestation Disrupts Global Rainfall Patterns
description: Research shows tropical forest loss reduces evapotranspiration and weakens atmosphere's ability to transport moisture, affecting rainfall patterns globally.

title: Earth's Water Cycle Bent to Breaking Point
description: Analysis shows tropical landscapes need 60% canopy cover to maintain atmospheric recycling supporting historical precipitation levels.

title: Diverse Forests Offer Climate Resilience in Panama
description: 16-year study found species-rich planted forests grow more stable over time and maintain carbon storage during droughts and intense storms.

title: Kashmir Ecosystem Disrupted by Changing Weather Patterns
description: Unpredictable rainfall and rising temperatures causing glacier melt, ecosystem disruption, and altered species migration patterns.

title: Sahel Forest Garden Project Combats Desertification
description: Forest garden approach in Sahel addresses extreme weather, increasing dry seasons, and declining soil fertility from climate change.

title: Northern Thailand Watershed Restoration Improves Water Quality
description: Hmong community restored 33 hectares of watershed forest, reducing water cloudiness and preventing rain runoff for reliable water supply.

title: Brazil's Mantiqueira Mountains Restoration Protects Urban Water
description: 5,000 hectares restored in watershed serving São Paulo; over 2 million trees planted since 2005 to preserve water sources.

title: Philippine Indigenous Communities Restore Forest to Prevent Flooding
description: Restoration of headwater forests on Kalatungan and Kitanglad mountains improves flood control by storing and gradually releasing rainfall.

title: Amazon Recovery Policy Targets Atmospheric Water Recycling
description: Brazilian policy aims to reforest 15 million hectares in Southern Amazon to maintain atmospheric recycling supporting regional precipitation.

title: Tropical Forests Can Regenerate and Restore Carbon in 20 Years
description: Secondary forests near native vegetation patches can regain soil fertility and carbon storage within 20 years, restoring ecosystem functions.

title: China Loess Plateau Restoration Reduces Erosion and Flooding
description: Massive terracing and reforestation transformed 35,000 sq km of degraded land, reducing sediment flow and flood risk in Yellow River basin.

title: Costa Rica Forest Recovery Restores Local Water Supplies
description: Deforested areas suffered water scarcity as rain ran off hillsides; forest recovery restored tree root sponge effect retaining groundwater.

title: El Niño Compounds Deforestation Rainfall Impacts
description: Deforestation-caused rainfall reduction worsens during El Niño events, creating compounding climate stress on remaining forests.

title: Peatland Restoration in Temperate Nations Could Store Massive Carbon
description: World's peatlands hold 600 billion metric tons of carbon; restoration through rewetting can stem carbon releases and restore water tables.

title: Sumatra Peatland Rewetting Reduces Carbon Emissions
description: Blocking drainage canals raised water table, reduced soil carbon emissions by 6-24 metric tons per hectare per year, and native trees returning.

title: Congo Basin Peatlands Hold More Carbon Than All Forests
description: Central Congo peatlands store equivalent of 3 years global fossil fuel emissions; protection critical for climate stability.

title: Peru's Pastaza Peatlands Among World's Largest Carbon Reservoirs
description: Amazon peatlands in Peru store billions of tons of carbon; water table management critical for preventing emissions.

title: Great Green Wall Progress in Senegal
description: Senegal has planted over 12 million trees as part of the Great Green Wall initiative, creating new livelihoods and reversing desertification.

title: Great Green Wall Data Tracking Improves Outcomes
description: Collaboration and satellite monitoring help track 100 million hectare restoration goal across Sahel, sequestering 250 million tons of carbon.

title: Niger Farmer-Managed Natural Regeneration
description: Farmers in Niger regenerated 5 million hectares of trees using traditional techniques, improving rainfall infiltration and crop yields.

title: Ethiopia Tigray Landscape Restoration
description: Community-led terracing and tree planting restored degraded hillsides, improving water retention and reducing flood damage.

title: India Green Wall to Combat Desertification
description: Green walls help stabilize dust storms, avert wind erosion, and serve as carbon sinks using locally adapted tree species.

title: Burkina Faso Stone Bund Water Harvesting
description: Traditional stone bund technique captures rainfall, recharges groundwater, and has restored thousands of hectares of degraded farmland.

title: Cameroon Reforestation 1400 Project
description: Reforestation project aims to restore degraded lands and combat desertification in northern Cameroon despite challenges from logging.

title: Chad Great Green Wall Efforts
description: Tree planting in Chad's portion of the Great Green Wall helping stabilize soils and restore degraded landscapes.

title: Mali Sahel Restoration
description: Restoration efforts in Mali combat desertification despite conflict challenges, using indigenous knowledge and drought-resistant species.

title: Mauritania Anti-Desertification Efforts
description: Mauritania plants drought-resistant species as part of Great Green Wall to slow desert advance and protect communities.

title: Sudan Gum Arabic Belt Restoration
description: Restoration of acacia forests for gum arabic production helps combat desertification while providing income for communities.

title: Djibouti Great Green Wall Terminal Point
description: Eastern terminus of Great Green Wall project focuses on drought-resistant species and water harvesting in extremely arid conditions.

title: Kenya Drylands Restoration
description: Kenya restores degraded drylands through community-based natural resource management, improving water availability and reducing erosion.

title: Nigeria Kebbi State Reforestation
description: Northern Nigeria plants millions of trees to combat desert encroachment and restore rainfall patterns in agricultural areas.

title: Eritrea Highland Restoration
description: Eritrea's highland restoration through terracing and tree planting improves water retention in water-scarce regions.

title: Indonesia Peat Fire Prevention Through Rewetting
description: Indonesian government rewets degraded peatlands to prevent fires that release massive amounts of carbon dioxide.

title: Borneo Heart of Borneo Initiative
description: Three-nation conservation initiative protects and restores 22 million hectares of rainforest affecting regional rainfall patterns.

title: Malaysia Sabah Rainforest Restoration
description: Sabah restores logged rainforest areas, improving watershed function and maintaining rainfall in agricultural lowlands.

title: Papua New Guinea Forest Conservation
description: Community-managed forests in PNG maintain rainfall patterns and water supplies for downstream communities.

title: Solomon Islands Mangrove Restoration
description: Coastal communities restore mangroves for storm protection and maintaining freshwater lens in low-lying islands.

title: Fiji Mangrove and Reef Restoration
description: Fiji restores mangroves and coral reefs to protect coastlines from storms and maintain fisheries productivity.

title: Mekong Delta Mangrove Restoration Vietnam
description: Vietnam restores mangroves in Mekong Delta to protect against typhoons and saltwater intrusion from sea level rise.

title: Bangladesh Sundarbans Protection
description: World's largest mangrove forest protects 20 million people from cyclones; restoration expands buffer zone.

title: Myanmar Ayeyarwady Delta Restoration
description: Mangrove restoration in Myanmar's delta region reduces storm surge impacts and supports fisheries recovery.

title: Sri Lanka Coastal Restoration
description: Post-tsunami mangrove restoration provides natural barriers against storms and supports fishing communities.

title: Philippines Mangrove Rehabilitation
description: Community-based mangrove restoration protects coastal villages from typhoons and improves fish nursery habitat.

title: Thailand Mangrove Conservation
description: Thailand's mangrove conservation reduces coastal erosion and maintains carbon storage in coastal sediments.

title: Ecuador Mangrove Restoration
description: Ecuador restores mangroves along Pacific coast, improving water quality and protecting shrimp farming areas from storms.

title: Mexico Caribbean Reef Restoration
description: Coral reef restoration in Mexican Caribbean protects coastlines from hurricanes and maintains tourism-based economy.

title: Honduras Bay Islands Reef Conservation
description: Marine protected areas restore reef health, maintaining fish populations and storm protection for island communities.

title: Colombia Pacific Mangroves
description: Mangrove restoration along Colombia's Pacific coast protects communities from flooding and maintains fisheries.

title: Brazil Amazon Floodplain Restoration
description: Várzea forest restoration maintains flood regulation and fish spawning habitat in Amazon tributaries.

title: Argentina Paraná Delta Wetlands
description: Wetland restoration in Paraná Delta improves flood control for Buenos Aires region and maintains biodiversity.

title: Chile Valdivian Rainforest Restoration
description: Temperate rainforest restoration in Chile maintains high rainfall capture and supports endemic species recovery.

title: Peru Cloud Forest Protection
description: Andean cloud forest conservation maintains fog capture providing water for downstream agriculture and cities.

title: Bolivia Yungas Forest Conservation
description: Conservation of Yungas cloud forests maintains water supply for La Paz and surrounding agricultural areas.

title: Venezuela Orinoco Delta Restoration
description: Wetland restoration in Orinoco Delta supports Indigenous communities and maintains carbon storage in peat soils.

title: Guyana Rainforest Conservation
description: Low-deforestation strategy maintains regional rainfall patterns and earns carbon credits for forest protection.

title: Suriname Forest Protection
description: Nearly 95% forest cover maintained, contributing to regional rainfall recycling across northern South America.

title: French Guiana Protected Forests
description: Protected primary forest maintains evapotranspiration contributing to Amazon basin rainfall patterns.

title: Guatemala Maya Biosphere Restoration
description: Community forest concessions maintain forest cover and rainfall patterns in Petén region while reducing fires.

title: Belize Reef and Mangrove Protection
description: Barrier reef and mangrove protection provides storm buffering and maintains fisheries productivity.

title: Nicaragua Caribbean Coast Restoration
description: Forest and mangrove restoration on Mosquito Coast improves hurricane resilience and water quality.

title: Jamaica Blue Mountains Watershed
description: Watershed restoration in Blue Mountains improves water supply reliability for Kingston metropolitan area.

title: Haiti Reforestation Efforts
description: Reforestation efforts combat severe deforestation that has caused flooding, erosion, and water scarcity.

title: Dominican Republic Cloud Forest
description: Cloud forest protection in Cordillera Central maintains water supply for agriculture and hydropower.

title: Cuba Mangrove and Reef System
description: Largest mangrove system in Caribbean provides storm protection and carbon storage; active restoration ongoing.

title: Puerto Rico El Yunque Recovery
description: Tropical rainforest recovery after hurricanes demonstrates forest resilience and watershed protection.

title: Tanzania Eastern Arc Mountains
description: Ancient forest restoration maintains high rainfall in biodiversity hotspot and water supply for Dar es Salaam.

title: Uganda Rwenzori Watershed
description: Mountain forest restoration improves water supply for lowland agriculture and reduces flooding events.

title: Rwanda Forest Restoration Success
description: Rwanda increased forest cover from 10% to 30%, improving water retention and reducing erosion nationwide.

title: Burundi Watershed Protection
description: Community-based watershed restoration reduces soil erosion and improves water availability for farming.

title: Malawi Shire River Watershed
description: Watershed restoration improves hydropower reliability and reduces sedimentation in Lake Malombe.

title: Zambia Miombo Woodland Restoration
description: Woodland restoration improves seasonal water flow and reduces soil loss in degraded agricultural areas.

title: Zimbabwe Watershed Rehabilitation
description: Community-managed watershed rehabilitation improves water availability in drought-prone regions.

title: Botswana Okavango Delta Protection
description: Protection of world's largest inland delta maintains regional climate regulation and groundwater recharge.

title: Namibia Caprivi Woodland
description: Woodland conservation in Namibia's wettest region maintains local rainfall and flood regulation.

title: South Africa Working for Water Program
description: Invasive species removal restores native vegetation and water flow in drought-stressed catchments.

title: Lesotho Highland Restoration
description: Mountain grassland restoration improves water yield for Lesotho Highlands Water Project supplying South Africa.

title: Eswatini Watershed Management
description: Small watershed restoration projects improve water security in this water-stressed nation.

title: Gabon High Forest Conservation
description: Maintaining 88% forest cover contributes to regional rainfall recycling in Congo Basin.

title: Republic of Congo Forest Conservation
description: Intact forest maintains evapotranspiration critical for regional and continental rainfall patterns.

title: Central African Republic Forest Protection
description: Forest conservation maintains watershed function for tributaries feeding Lake Chad and Congo basins.

title: Equatorial Guinea Bioko Island
description: Island forest protection maintains orographic rainfall and water supply for Malabo.

title: São Tomé Cloud Forest
description: Small island cloud forest restoration captures fog water and maintains endemic species habitat.

title: Angola Miombo Restoration
description: Woodland restoration across Angola improves seasonal water availability after decades of civil war.

title: Mozambique Gorongosa Restoration
description: National park restoration increases wildlife and forest cover, improving watershed function.

title: Madagascar Eastern Rainforest Corridor
description: Forest corridor restoration maintains rainfall for rice agriculture in central highlands.

title: Comoros Island Restoration
description: Small island restoration improves water capture on steep volcanic slopes for agriculture.

title: Mauritius Native Forest Restoration
description: Removing invasive species and restoring native forest improves water yield from mountain catchments.

title: Seychelles Island Restoration
description: Removing invasive species from islands restores seabird colonies that fertilize surrounding reefs.

title: Réunion Watershed Management
description: Volcanic island watershed management improves water quality and reduces cyclone flood damage.

title: Yemen Socotra Island Conservation
description: Endemic dragonblood tree forest conservation maintains unique island ecosystem and water capture.

title: Oman Dhofar Mountains
description: Monsoon-dependent cloud forest conservation maintains seasonal water supply for southern Oman.

title: UAE Mangrove Planting
description: Abu Dhabi plants millions of mangroves for carbon capture and coastal protection from sea level rise.

title: Iran Wetland Restoration
description: Lake Urmia restoration efforts attempt to reverse desiccation affecting regional climate and dust storms.

title: Iraq Mesopotamian Marshes
description: Restoration of Mesopotamian marshes after Saddam-era draining, improving regional humidity and cooling.

title: Jordan Dead Sea Watershed
description: Watershed restoration in Jordan Valley reduces erosion and improves water retention in arid conditions.

title: Lebanon Cedar Forest Restoration
description: Iconic cedar forest restoration improves snow capture and spring water flow in Mount Lebanon.

title: Turkey Southeastern Anatolia Greening
description: Large-scale tree planting in GAP region improves microclimate and reduces dust storms.
